column4: dhcp is automatic which is good if u dont have much experience networking.. ur router (if you have one) should tell dhcp everything
u guys talk like you have to do everything manually..  ubuntu installation didnt seem to be so difficult to me
Some of us are used to the old way of doing things.
There are two drivers, one is free, but doesn't have 3D acceleration. The other is proprietary and is barely legal, and can't be included in a default distro.
